citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
At time of inspection there is no written program of veterinary care available for review. The facility representative stated
that no corrections have been made since the last inspection. Failure to maintain a program of veterinary care may put
animals at risk for injury and illness and impedes APHIS Officials' ability to carry out their duties. Each dealer shall employ
an attending veterinarian under formal arrangements. In the case of a part-time attending veterinarian, the formal
arrangements shall include a written program of veterinary care and regularly scheduled visits to the premises of the
dealer.

No disposition records were available for 2 African dormice that were sold since the last inspection according to the facility
representative. Failure to maintain required records impedes APHIS officials' ability to perform their duties and fully
assess welfare and traceability of regulated animals. Every dealer shall make, keep, and maintain records or forms which
fully and correctly disclose information concerning animals that are purchased or otherwise acquired, or which are
transported, sold, euthanized, or otherwise disposed of by the dealer.

The facility representative stated there is no written contingency plan. Contingency plans help prepare facilities on how to
provide humane handling of animals during emergencies. The dealer must develop a complete contingency plan tailored
to the facility and animals on hand. All employees must be trained on their roles and responsibilities within this plan and
the facility must maintain documentation of annual reviews of the plan.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representative.
n

narrative:
2.40(a)(1)  Repeat
   
Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors). 
At time of inspection there is no written program of veterinary care available for review. The facility representative stated 
that no corrections have been made since the last inspection. Failure to maintain a program of veterinary care may put 
animals at risk for injury and illness and impedes APHIS Officials' ability to carry out their duties. Each dealer shall employ 
an attending veterinarian under formal arrangements. In the case of a part-time attending veterinarian, the formal 
arrangements shall include a written program of veterinary care and regularly scheduled visits to the premises of the 
dealer. 
2.75(b)(1)  Repeat
   
Records: Dealers and exhibitors. 
No disposition records were available for 2 African dormice that were sold since the last inspection according to the facility 
representative. Failure to maintain required records impedes APHIS officials' ability to perform their duties and fully 
assess welfare and traceability of regulated animals. Every dealer shall make, keep, and maintain records or forms which 
fully and correctly disclose information concerning animals that are purchased or otherwise acquired, or which are 
transported, sold, euthanized, or otherwise disposed of by the dealer. 
2.134(a)  Repeat
   
Contingency planning. 
The facility representative stated there is no written contingency plan. Contingency plans help prepare facilities on how to 
provide humane handling of animals during emergencies. The dealer must develop a complete contingency plan tailored 
to the facility and animals on hand. All employees must be trained on their roles and responsibilities within this plan and 
the facility must maintain documentation of annual reviews of the plan. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representative.
